entry.title: Russia warns Armenia of following Ukraine in search for new partners

media:group.media:title: Russia warns Armenia of following Ukraine in search for new partners
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia dismissed a report it signed a closed-door, $500-million arms deal with Iran. üìç A Kremlin spokesperson reaffirmed Russia still considers Armenia an ally, even while warning Yerevan not to follow Ukraine‚Äôs geopolitical path. üìç The wife of a senior official at Armenia‚Äôs Economy Ministry was hired by a ski resort development company after her husband played a key role approving the firm‚Äôs flagship project in the country. Full investigation: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/790000/armenian-deputy-minister-may-have-conflict-of-interest-in-ski-resort-project/ üìç Populists vs. Elites: The Battle for Western Civilization (and Armenia) : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pc8AhHtLWVo&t=1320s üìç Food and Flavors of Dilijan with Varda Avetisyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L_-3Bh6-Upc

entry.title: Populists vs. Elites: The Battle for Western Civilization (and Armenia)

media:group.media:title: Populists vs. Elites: The Battle for Western Civilization (and Armenia)
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of CivilNet's podcast, Eric Hacopian delivers a no-holds-barred analysis of the global political landscape, dissecting the French elections, Iranian Presidential elections, European parliamentary shifts, and the looming US presidential race. He addresses the influence these events can have on Armenia and its nascent western reorientation.
Also watch: https://youtu.be/KDLfAjPUoEA

media:group.media:title: Food and Flavors of Dilijan
media:group.media:description:
Varda Avetisyan is a successful restaurant owner in Dilijan, Armenia, although she did not always think that would be the case. In her youth, she had the opportunity to leave Armenia and study in Chicago. After graduation, she realized that sharing her food with the community was what would bring her the most fulfillment in life, and she moved back to Armenia. Watch Varda share her experience in Armenia‚Äôs restaurant industry and talk about why she lets chasing her happiness drive her career.

entry.title: Biking City: Is there hope for Yerevan?

media:group.media:title: Biking City: Is there hope for Yerevan?
media:group.media:description:
Riding a bicycle early in the morning in Yerevan is easy, there are no cars or people. But, can you ride a bike at any other time of day? Is Yerevan a city for cyclists? Armenia‚Äôs prime minister is often encouraging the use of bicycles in a city that doesn‚Äôt have a single designated bike lane. Most cyclists are forced to ride on the sidewalk, which is neither pleasant nor safe.
